(A) Evidence of Erosion: This stream is frequently silty due to agricultural and urban runoff.
(C) Water levels: Stream did not experience a major flood this year.
(D) Spawning distribution: The spawners were observed between Copley Park and Mann Ave. Viaduct Creek (trib.) is overgrown and inaccessible to spawners.
(I) Habitat change: Placement of spawning gravel, large boulders, deep pools recommended.
(K) Additional comments: Continued extensive urban development of the watershed has played havoc with the hydraulic conditions of the creek. 40000 Coho fry (Goldstream Stock) were released into Colquitz in spring of 1992.
